subject: Business
title: Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning
description: Learn Segmentation, Targeting, Positioning in one minute.

hook.text: A shoe company that markets to 'everyone who wears shoes' will be outsold by one that targets marathon runners.

buildup.text: STP is the classic framework: segment the market, pick your target, then position for that target.

discovery.text: Segmentation divides a market by needs, behavior, or demographics into groups with shared characteristics.

twist.text: The counterintuitive part: a smaller target often yields a bigger business. Focus creates loyalty and word-of-mouth.

climax.text: Dollar Shave Club targeted men annoyed by expensive razors. That narrow focus built a $1 billion brand.

punchline.text: Narrow your target. Deepen your impact.

quiz.question: What are the three steps of STP?
